instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_LIO</SIGNAL> is going up and down and maxing out at 5.1V. This was a liquid-damaged computer but like most of these it didn't hit the board directly. Normally I would be looking for a short at this point, but I'm not finding anything. Any ideas where to go with this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Power.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVBUS_LIO</SIGNAL> should not be going low. I would suspect the board is running into a short somewhere and pulling it down. You could inject up to 15V on this bus to see if there is any excess current draw and heating somewhere.
